At the same time, we believe that any management actions should be subject 374 to rigorous quantitative analysis to explore possible long-term impacts. In particular, 375 allocating resources and scientific endeavours to the management of wildlife diseases such as 376 DFTD should not disguise the fact that sufficiently large and undisturbed natural 377 environments are a vital prerequisite for wildlife to persist and eventually cope with 378 perturbations such as infectious diseases without human intervention.
